CurrentFlowSolutionAxiTransient

class pyrit.solution.CurrentFlowSolutionAxiTransient(description: str, potential: ndarray, axi_mesh: mesh.AxiMesh, tri_axi_nodal_shape_function: shapefunction.TriAxisymmetricNodalShapeFunction, regions: Regions, materials: Materials, excitations: Excitations, time_steps: ndarray, monitor_solutions: Dict[str, Tuple[ndarray, ndarray]])

Bases: TransientSolution

The solution of a transient electroquasistatic problem in axisymmetric coordinates.

The corresponding problem class is CurrentFlowProblemAxiTransient.

Constructor.

Parameters

  • description –

  • vector_potential –

  • axi_mesh –

  • tri_axi_nodal_shape_function –

  • regions –

  • materials –

  • excitations –

alias of CurrentFlowSolutionAxiIntermediate

The scalar potential. These are the coefficients for the basis functions.

  • index (int) – The index of a time instance.

static absolute_field(field: Union[ndarray, Dict[Any, ndarray]])

Computes the absolute field.

Parameters

field (Union[np.ndarray, Dict[Any, np.ndarray]]) – Either a field or a dictionary with the values being fields.

Returns

absolute_field – The absolute value of the fields.

Return type

Union[np.ndarray, Dict[Any, np.ndarray]]

:raises ValueError : When the input array is not of one of ht expected shapes.:

property end_time

The end time of the problem.

get_animation_indices(times: Iterable[float], indices: Union[Iterable[int], int]) → ndarray

Return indices used for the animation.

If indices is an integer n, return an array with every n-th index, ensuring that the last index is contained. If times and indices is None, return an array on all indices. If only one of both is not None, return an array of the appropriate indices. If both are not None, an Exception is raised.

Parameters

  • times (Iterable[float]) – An iterable with time instances.

  • indices (Union[Iterable[int], int]) – An iterable with indices.

Returns

indices – An array of the indices.

Return type

np.ndarray

get_index(time: float, index: int) → int

Returns the appropriate index of time_steps.

If time and index are None, returns None. If only one of both is not None, returns the appropriate index. If both are not None, raises a ValueError.

Parameters

  • time (float) – A time instance.

  • index (int) – An index.

Returns

index – The appropriate index.

Return type

int

Raises

ValueError – When time and index are both not None.

get_indices(times: Iterable[float], indices: Iterable[int]) → List[int]

Return a list of corresponding indices according to times and indices.

If times and indices are None, returns None. If only one of both is not None, returns the appropriate list. If both are not None, raises a ValueError.

Parameters

  • times (Iterable[float]) – An iterable with time instances.

  • indices (Iterable[int]) – An iterable with indices.

Returns

indices – A list of appropriate indices.

Return type

List[int]

Raises

ValueError – When times and indices are both not None.

get_interpolation(time: float) → Tuple[List[int], List[float]]

Get indices and weights for a linear interpolation.

Parameters

time (float) – A time instance.

Returns

  • indices (List[int]) – The indices of the time steps that has to be taken for the interpolation.

  • weights (Lsit[float]) – The weights for the indices that has to be taken for the interpolation.

get_static_solution(*, time: Optional[float] = None, index: Optional[int] = None) → StaticSolution

Return an instance of static solution at the specified time instance.

If not time instance is given, take the last time step.

Parameters

  • time (float) – A time instance.

  • index (int) – An index.

Returns

static_solution – Related static solution at the specified time instance.

Return type

StaticSolution

initialize_attributes()

Initialize the protected attributes needed for the properties.

static load(path: Union[str, Path]) → Solution

Load a solution.

Parameters

path (Union[str, Path]) – The path. If a string is given, it is converted to a Path object. The file ending can but must not be given. In any case it will be a .pkl file. See pickle doc for more information.

Returns

solution – A solution instance.

Return type

Solution

load_vector_eqs(*, time=None, index=None)

The load vector (EQS).

Parameters

  • time (float, optional) – Time instance.

  • index (int, optional) – The index of a time instance.

Returns

result – If either time or index given, the load vector (EQS) at the corresponding time instance. Otherwise, a dictionary with all already computed values of the load vector (EQS) at time instances.

Return type

Union[sparse.coo_matrix, Dict[int, sparse.coo_matrix]]

save(path: Union[str, Path], ignore_attributes: Optional[List[str]] = None) → Path

Saves the solution instance.

Parameters

  • path (Union[str, Path]) –

    The path. If a string is given, it is converted to a Path object. The file ending can but must not be given. In any case it will be a .pkl file. See pickle doc for more information. If the path contains a non-existing folder, this folder will be created.

  • ignore_attributes (List[str], optional) – A list of attributes that are not included in the saved file. The default value is ignore_for_saving of the object.

Returns

path – The path that was used for opening the file.

Return type

Path

classmethod solution_from_problem(description: str, problem: TransientProblem, solution: ndarray, monitor_solutions: Dict[str, Tuple[ndarray, ndarray]] = None) → TransientSolution

Create a transient solution from a transient problem.

Parameters

  • description (str) – Description of the transient solution.

  • problem (TransientProblem) – A transient problem.

  • solution (np.ndarray) – The solution of the transient problem.

  • monitor_solutions (Dict[str, Tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray]], optional) – The monitor solutions.

Returns

transient_solution

Return type

TransientSolution
